text:
The copy task doesn't copy files with a filename longer than the OS max 
filename length when used in combination with JDK1.4.2.
When using JDK1.5 or 1.6 it does correctly these files, even if they have 
filenames that are too long.
I looked in the bug DBs of Apache and Sun and didn't find anything that seemed 
to match this problem. I have a Eclipse project that shows this problem, but 
since I can't add attachements I can send them later by e-mail if neccessary. 
I hope this rings a bell with you guys, cos I'm lost.

creator: jandik@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 20348
RARed Eclipse project with testcase

For reproduction a the problem please place this project in a sufficiently long
path (mine was D:\eclipseworkspace_test\MaxPathLength, so length 39)

yes, this is a java problem that we CANTFIX; marking as WONTFIX

windows has this funniness, as it has two filename modes. Win16/dos compatible;
MAX_PATH=256, and full unicode mode where you can ask for things of
near-infinite length. Guess which one java <1.5 uses?
